WRITING.TEXT: For me, I would say Isco, he has grown more and more into his role, more than i've seen from Bale. Isco is like the spider in the middle of the net, building up everything into a tidy show. The same as Casemiro. Bale is replacable if you ask me, right now Isco is not. Also Isco is not a man made of glass like Bale. And sometimes it just feels like he's given up in the middle of a match where as Isco always fight on.

Also I would like to add that the real problem in the BBC is not Bale, it's the oaf Benzema...god damn I wish we got rid of him this transfer window, but seems like he is too close to Zizou and Perez.
Amazing is not the word, shit is the right one I think, but that's just my opinion, in every position that is.

WRITING.TITLE: Me [24 M] with my GF [24 F] 2 year relationship, need advice on argument.
WRITING.TEXT: I don't know where to start exactly, but I love my girlfriend very much, although we are very different we complement each other sometimes good, sometimes not. And it is the "not" thing that bothers me sometimes. We hade this argument tonight, she has been testriding a horse she wanted to buy from a friend, the same friend said that the horse was for sale. She has become close to the horse already and last night her friend said that she had changed her mind about it and wanted to keep the horse. Naturally my GF burst out in tears. I tried to comfort her and tried telling her things to improve her mood. This is when she snapped at me, with an awful attitude, and told me to lay off and only comfort her without trying to improve her mood, and she started to change all the direction of her negativity towards me. This is when i snapped and said that i would not accept that sort of behaviour, it's not my fault what happened with the horse, i'm laying here trying to comfort you in the best of ways and you attack me. I said that im tired of her behaviour when negative things happen to her and that she always put it all on me and snaps at me. She started crying more and wanted to apologise but I said that apologising doesn't change the fact that she always do this (we have discussed this before), she has to show me instead that she has changed in her approach to these kinds of situations. I wasn't having it so I said that I didn't want to talk more tonight or try to solve it, i just wanted to go to sleep (was really tired and i have work to go up to early in the morning). There was nothing to solve this night, she always puts all the anger towards me when someone else hurts her feelings and i'm kinda tired of it. Adults shouldn't behave this way. It all ended with her going to the livingroom and sleeping on the couch and crying. And I didn't want to comfort her anymore because I was also hurt and angry and wanted to sleep. My questions is, am I wrong to react this way during a sensitive situation? Am I wrong to be angry about it when she was this sad? And is it wrong to think that a person can change their ways when it comes to handling their emotions? Appreciate you all for reading this wall of text, really need some advice. *TL;DR; : My girlfriend often snaps out at me when she is sad or hurt by something or someone else than me. And this is a recent example. *.

Thanks for your answer. It makes me understand it a little bit more, i don't really know if she has some sort of anxiety about it, but I know that she has a lot of other anxietys and problems socially. The thing is, i'm just tired of her apologising, I don't want her to apologise, I want her to show me that she has actually thought about what i have said about the problem. Words are one thing but action is the way you show that you have taken in what the other person have told you. But I have one question for you, am I a coldhearted bastard for not comforting her when she moved to the other room and laid on the couch crying? I feel guilty but I dont want to give in to the crying when I was hurt and angry myself.

I get that i'm not without wrongdoing here, I know that I also could have reacted less. But I won't sugarcoat my words, "always" is the true word here, always she finds a way to snap at me when she is mad at something or someone else. And this is really the only problem we have in our relationship. I just scares me somehow when she does it, that she can cry and be teary eyed one minute and then suddently she's got this cocky aggressive attitude. I don't like it, she feels like another person. And thanks for your response, I was also looking for constructive criticism against me so I appreciate that as well.

gt; ke her feel bad The thing is, I would love for a solution like this, but it is almost impossible. Because when we fight, and it's not often, but when we do she always wants to solve it directly, she always wants to discuss it right away. I have tried leaving the room to avoid it but it just makes her follow me with tears in her eyes pleading for us to solve it and talk, and she begs for forgiveness. But we talked it over last night and we came to the conclusion that she will try harder not to direct her anger towards me and I will not leave the discussion, we will always try to solve it directly afterwards. And i appreciate the feedback!

A sad day, and I'm a Real Madrid fan, but a good player leaves La liga and football became more about the money then about the game and the glory. Ironically I never liked neymar very much but I love the sport.
Asensios goal was beautiful! Magic! Made me smile.

WRITING.TITLE: To remember who Bale is and what he's done for us until he gets back!!
Small thing but I need advice.
WRITING.TEXT: So me and the girlfriend has an awesome night at a hotel. And I took a lovely picture of her in a red dress. She said that she didn't like the photo and that she thought she was ugly in it...as usual. But I still wanted to put it up on social media and write how much I love her. Instead of getting happy she got really mad at me for putting up the picture she said that she didn't want me to put up. She told me to change the picture but instead I deleted the whole post because it's either the picture I pick or nothing at all. I won't alter something I uploaded out of love because she doesn't like how she looks in a picture. And for your information the picture was identical too all the others I took. And when I came home from work today she was still pissed off about it and was drinking a lot of soda and eating a whole bag of cheese doodles for comfort and was all cold on me after she had spammed me all day to remove the picture. So my question is if this is normal? We are both 24 years old, been together for two years. And I just feel like this is a very immature behavior . It's not like it's the first time but it's certainly the biggest reaction this far. I mean am I right for being mad at her right now for how immature she is? Or am I in the wrong? I wanna tell her how immature I think she is for our age but I don't know if that's a good idea. P.S. I've been with sensitive girls before but that was in my teens. Is this normal for adult women to be this sensitive? For such a small thing.
Thanks for replying, and yeah I know that she is insecure but I think that even if she is insecure the way she reacts over it is a lack of maturity when it comes to expressing herself. Or am I wrong?

But she says that every single picture I take is ugly? If I always did as she said I would never be able to put up a picture of her. And I never do stuff to show off to people, how dare you? I did it to express my love openly and because I wanted to put up a picture on my birthday, since that was what we were celebrating and I wanted to thank her for the whole day.

She never thinks she looks good in any pics? If I followed that all the time then I would never be able to put up any picture of her. And since she payed for a hotel and a restaurant and gave me a nice present I saw it fitting to post a beautiful picture of my girlfriend and tell her how thankful I am for having such a woman in my life. And then all I get is piss all over me? How am I rude? Please explain.

So I should put up a picture of a black box and thank my girlfriend instead or never put up something that has to do with her? Or maybe she could just have appreciated my gesture instead? No I think that in a normal adult relationship one should be able to take pictures of each other some times and also express your adoration towards each other and show what a beautiful and kind hearted partner you have to others, to raise her and not to show off.

You really don't understand huh? So if let's say you did something wonderful for your parents. The next day when you wake up, you see that they posted a picture of you on let's say Facebook and thanked you and told all of your friends and family how much they appreciate and love you. You think the right response to that is to write to them and tell them how immature they are and how they need to grow up and how stupid it is to care how you appear on social media? No sir, you are the immature one, and the one who needs to grow up. And I don't understand all this focus on me uploading a picture on social media and why I want to do that. My question was about the resulting behavior around the situation, not the social media thing itself. God damn.

Damn you are a damn lunatic, and a fucking jerk, keep calm. She loves when I do it, this time she didn't, what do you know? Nothing. So don't even reply anymore. For your information she has done the same to me without me even reacting. So don't try and make me sound like a thick headed idiot with you trying to be clear with me what she likes and don't like.
Damn, if he really said this, I'm a bit salty as well. A real king shouldn't have to declare himself as a king. This is disappointing...
Why all these Barca fans in our sub? You jealous of our sub now? You don't have your own?

Dont you dare criticize a player who has piss poor form, misses shots 2 meters in front of goal, treats his fellow national team players like trash. A player who is not a striker but a straight passer to cr7 in a nr9 shirt. Who has cost us a lot of important matches with his inability to score and who sometimes seem to disappear when he should be fighting for his career. How dare you!! We shall all downvote you! (I'm talking like this to be able to criticize without getting shot down by all the fanboys)

You know that formations get to much of a blame when things go wrong. Everyone who has played football knows that it looks good on paper when you have a certain formation but when the game starts, people run all over the place to perform the idea that the manager has planned. A formation is a good backbone but it's not that important in the end.

I didn't say that it doesn't matter? Tell me where I wrote this? I said that it gets too much of the blame if someone loses. Especially us this season. And I have actually seen a clip of Johan Cruyf saying that a formation is just a backbone and when the game starts we play a bit differently. So if you think my views are on an amateur level then so are cruyfs

As far as I've heard and read cruyf is seen as a tactical genius and his best asset was his understanding of the game? I think I will rather take the words of an actual player of the game at the highest level than from you. He said in the clip that all looks well and good on paper but when the match starts there is a lot of fluidity through the formation, players flow between each others positions to and from. Formations he said is also a simplified version of explaining the tactics for people who doesn't know football at an advanced level, and in reality there is a lot more behind it.
Bale has attitude problems right? I mean I love the guy to death but still #128514;
That is what makes you confident? Being able to not care about what people think? It comes from the inside and from how people treat you on the outside.
Exactly! So how Real Madrid perform this season can't be blamed so much on the actually formation but more of the tactics from zidane and the players performances themselves.

WRITING.TITLE: Calmate Los Blancos Por Favor...
WRITING.TEXT: So, I have been reading a lot of depressing stuff on this forum lately, though it seems reoccurring every season no matter what happens. So for one, yes we have had a beautiful streak of winning three champions league titles in a row, and yes we have only won one la liga title during this time. You see you can pick holes through everything, and when you get something you have striven for you just want more. This is important but it is just as important to not forget and writhe in agony and pity. All these threads complaining about our situation doesn't help anyone, it makes the threadstarters anxious and the readers anxious. So come one, the season hasn't started yet, but the complaints have. I don't know what careers any of you have, but I think that it's most likely not a position of power in the club or a position at all. The people at Real Madrid are no morons or imbeciles, they know what they are doing, they have had the exact conversations we have had in this forum, albeit with more confidence i guess. So believe me or believe in the club, they are working on it. This is their job, and they have done it well and the evidence is in the clubs history. Believing in the club is one of the most important aspects of being a supporter and the belief lately has been weak. Please don't be weak, be strong, together we are Real Madrid! P.S. I hope the players of the club never sees what has been written here lately, it would make them disappointed I believe.

More posts like this please. It boosts morale for everybody. It is not like this is their first season in charge, if it was the accusations would have had some grain of truth in them. But these are seasoned tacticians and businessmen.

The thing is, you have a right to post critique and we should never bury our heads in the sand. But the general posts I have seen have been complaining, not giving critique, there is a difference. And for one, complaining never helps anyone, and strong people don't complain. The club is positive I think, and so is the management, they reflect it anyhow, and so should we as supporters. Because it has been toxic to read this forum lately.
I tried at least haha. My Spanish is not very good. If you could reply with the correct term, it would help.
I appreciate the lecture, I really do, this is good criticism, not complaining like in most threads. I always like to learn.

I think they have earned the right of us having faith in them, how much or how little is really up to yourself. And when it comes to questionable decisions I understand, for the uninvited a lot of decision can seem questionable. The thing is, everything is not about what we want as a club and about the economical aspect, neither you or I have a definitive answer of what was fully behind Ronaldos transfer. One aspect for the club was the money of course, but if Ronaldo wanted to leave don't you think he has earned the right to make that decision? I personally think it was a mixture of a lot of different aspects, it is rarely as simple as a one answer question. It was the right time, the right price and the right emotional drive. And I think it is a different subject when it comes to the Man Utd situation, it is harder to compare to now. And when it comes to Modric, of course I want him to stay, but not at the cost of what may punish us down the road, we don't know what will have the most positive outcome, forcing modric to stay two seasons more with kovacic on the bench and ceballos with no playing time. Or letting kovacic shouldering the responsibility and see where it leads while we cash out on the best possible deal we will ever get for Modric. Time will tell, it is a risky game, but risky games give the greatest rewards. I have faith until proven otherwise.

Even when you assemble your house accordingly and as good as possible certain events may still blow all that away. You can be as good as tiger woods in PGA and still lose. You can be be the best motogp racer in the world and still crash. Just because we had one season in recent history where we didn't do as good as planned it doesn't mean that they don't know what they are doing, losing is learning. And using the experience from our failed la Liga season is exactly what I think they are doing. And calling my opinion a load of shit won't get you anywhere else than reproach from people and bad karma for you. And I don't really mind so you don't need to tell me your sorry, it's ok, I understand your anxiousness. Nobody is excused from criticism, which I didn't say, but I feel that most of the "criticism" has been more of a complaining than true criticism. Just my five cents.
I don't even know what to answer here. You are projecting stuff now out of the blue. The season hasn't even begun, calm down.

Of course there is a lot of work to be done, i don't think no one has denied that fact. But from my viewpoint that is exactly what has been done so far, a new manager with new tactics and some small transfers is moving in the right direction. We don't know the outcome of these changes until the season has begun. For me that means it is to early to start calling things a load of bullshit.

Look, I'm with you, I never said that we shouldn't be skeptic, or that we should kid ourselves about the nature of the situation. I was just posting this to try and stop all the complaining, and stop all the shit throwing. I't reeks of toxicity in this forum lately. But what I am saying also is that I myself will at least give them until the beginning of the season until i start trying to predict our whole season. So to underline, everything is not well, everything is not a 100% and sad things has happened lately but that doesn't mean we should throw a shitfest at our club before they have even started playing the season.

My name doesn't imply 24/7 skepticism, it is put where I feel it is needed. And I haven't said that I am not skeptic to it all right now, but I'm not gonna start complaining about every little thing because of that. I am skeptic, but I am holding off my judgement of it all until the season is in full swing and there actually is more content to critique.

WRITING.TEXT: "Gal #225;cticos (Spanish for galactics, referring to superstars) are expensive, world-famous Real Madrid football players" Actually I can't find any definition that says that a galactico is only someone who has won a Ballon D'or. It is generally considered to be a superstar signing.
